page.title: 04ALTON WATER RESERVOIR P.1
page.content: One of the biggest changes in recent years was the building of the Alton Water Reservoir.The eight million pound reservoir is between the villages of Tattingstone,Holbrook and Stutton. Prior to the bulding of the reservoir the demand for water in the area was rising at a rate of about 6% a year. The water for this area was obtained from local supplies of underground water in the chalk of the Gipping Valley which could not meet the demand. The reservoir was started in 1972 and finished by 1978 and covers about 400 acres of the Alton Valley.It supplies much needed water to farms industrial firms and a population of 245,000 throughout the Ipswich area. The reservoir holds about 2,000,000,000 gallons of water.It also provides an amenity for the Ipswich area.
